Ingredients.1: 4 (5 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves

Ingredients.3: 0.5 teaspoon coarse sea salt, or to taste

Ingredients.4: 1 pinch Creole seasoning (such as Tony Chachere's®), or more to taste

Ingredients.5: 1 tablespoon chicken broth, or more to taste

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).

Directions.2: Rub chicken breasts with olive oil and sprinkle both sides with salt and Creole seasoning. Place chicken in a broiler pan.

Directions.3: Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Flip chicken and cook until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 15 minutes more. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

Directions.5: Pour chicken broth into the pan and scrape any browned bits off the bottom with a flat-edged wooden spatula. Add more broth if needed to dislodge the browned bits, but not too much or it will be watery.

Directions.6: To serve, drizzle the pan sauce over the chicken.
